ENGLISH: REMOVE HASH FOR ACTIVE EVENTS AND OPTIONS
Angola
The Angolan Independence

From the demands of angolan intellectuals to the recent popular uprisings, the nationalist sentiment in Angola is now widespread and irreversible. The United Nations recognize the right of self determination of all peoples and the legitimacy of our rule in Angola is hardly defensible. What shall be our position?
Grant immediate independence ensuring good diplomatic relations.
Allow self-rule while keeping control over foreign affairs.
Angola is an integral part of our territory and forever will be.
The Angolan Independence

The angolan government has been so far complacent with our rule, but after a recent wave of nationalist and pan-african sentiments the status quo is no longer sustainable. Their leaders wish to negotiate a peaceful transition to full indepence, but they are willing to fight for it if necessary.
This was inevitable, grant them independence.
Insubordination will not be tolerated.
The Angolan War

Armed groups of rebel militias continue to terrorize the population in Angola. Our position has always been to keep the integrity of the national territory despite some internal opposition, but international pressure has increased with more and more countries supporting the immediate independence of Angola. Now the choice between fighting for a territory rightfuly ours at great cost or to give in and save face is yours.
Enough is enough. Accept defeat with dignity.
Crush the rebel scum! Angola is ours!
The Angolan War

Despite our best efforts, the war rages on. The insurgent government has managed to hold its territory and more armed rebel militias are ready to fight. Through backdoor diplomacy we know the insurgents are willing to negotiate, shall we take the opportunity and cease hostilities or take this war to the bitter end?
Negotiate while we have the upper hand.
We don't negotiate with terrorists.

The ghanaian government has been so far complacent with our rule, but after a recent wave of nationalist and pan-african sentiments the status quo is no longer sustainable. Their leaders wish to negotiate a peaceful transition to full indepence, but they are willing to fight for it if necessary.
This was inevitable, grant them independence.
Insubordination will not be tolerated.
The Ghanaian War

Armed groups of rebel militias continue to terrorize the population in Ghana. Our position has always been to keep the integrity of the national territory despite some internal opposition, but international pressure has increased with more and more countries supporting the immediate independence of Ghana. Now the choice between fighting for a territory rightfuly ours at great cost or to give in and save face is yours.
Enough is enough. Accept defeat with dignity.
Crush the rebel scum! Ghana is ours!
The Ghanaian War

Despite our best efforts, the war rages on. The insurgent government has managed to hold its territory and more armed rebel militias are ready to fight. Negotiate while we have the upper hand.

Our position has always been to keep the integrity of the national territory despite some internal opposition, but international pressure has increased with more and more countries supporting the immediate independence of Somalia. Now the choice between fighting for a territory rightfuly ours at great cost or to give in and save face is yours.
Enough is enough. Accept defeat with dignity.
Crush the rebel scum! Somalia is ours!
The Somali War

Despite our best efforts, the war rages on. The insurgent government has managed to hold its territory and more armed rebel militias are ready to fight. Through backdoor diplomacy we know the insurgents are willing to negotiate, shall we take the opportunity and cease hostilities or take this war to the bitter end?
Negotiate while we have the upper hand.
We don't negotiate with terrorists.
Sudan
The Sudanese Independence

From the demands of sudanese intellectuals to the recent popular uprisings, the nationalist sentiment in Sudan is now widespread and irreversible. The United Nations recognize the right of self determination of all peoples and the legitimacy of our rule in Sudan is hardly defensible. What shall be our position?
Grant immediate independence ensuring good diplomatic relations.
Allow self-rule while keeping control over foreign affairs.
Sudan is an integral part of our territory and forever will be.
The Sudanese Independence

The sudanese government has been so far complacent with our rule, but after a recent wave of nationalist and pan-african sentiments the status quo is no longer sustainable. Their leaders wish to negotiate a peaceful transition to full indepence, but they are willing to fight for it if necessary.
This was inevitable, grant them independence.
Insubordination will not be tolerated.
